history.proof: intros E1 E2. apply (IN E1 E2).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
Ens -> Ens -> Prop

Premises:
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rec : forall P : Ens -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
ssrbool.prop_on2 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, P x y) -> Prop
Decidable.decidable = fun P : Prop => P \/ ~ P : Prop -> Prop Arguments Decidable.decidable _%type_scope
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.lt_alt = fun n m : BinNums.N => exists p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.add (BinNat.N.succ p) n = m : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop
Inductive and4 (P1 P2 P3 P4 : Prop) : Prop := And4 : P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> ssrbool.and4 P1 P2 P3 P4 Arguments ssrbool.and4 (_ _ _ _)%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.And4 [P1 P2 P3 P4]%type_scope
QArith_base.Qle = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum x) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden y))) (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum y) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden x))) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qle (_ _)%Q_scope
Inductive EXType (P : Type) (Q : P -> Prop) : Prop := EXTypei : forall x : P, Q x -> EXType P Q Arguments EXType _%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments EXTypei _%type_scope _%function_scope
Record sign_theory (C : Type) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (get_sign : C -> option C) : Prop := mksign_th { sign_spec : forall c c' : C, get_sign c = Some c' -> ceqb c (copp c') = true } Arguments Ring_theory.sign_theory [C]%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mksign_th [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
